5 Clear Signs of Gaslighting in a Marriage, According to a Mental Health Expert
author: Beth Ann Mayer
segments: Mental health experts repeatedly report that
has become a buzzy, misused and overused word—even when it's referring to
"The term
has been adopted into popular culture and is often used incorrectly," says

an assistant professor of clinical mental health counseling at Lebanon Valley College. "When two people are having a disagreement, or they view a situation differently, that is not gaslighting. It is also not gaslighting if someone confronts you about something or says or does something that you don’t like."
However, gaslighting is also something that can happen in relationships, and it's a form of emotional abuse that can affect
, sleep and other aspects of your physical and mental health.
"In its truest sense, gaslighting occurs when one person deliberately manipulates situations to make the other person question their reality," she explains.
Dr. Richardson says gaslighting can happen within marriages. She notes that it's vital to understand the signs of gaslighting in a marriage and what to do to protect your well-being.

Name-calling may not break your bones. However, it's a sign of gaslighting when the names hurled in your direction cause you to question your reality. It's also emotionally abusive, even if it doesn't leave physical scars.

Dr. Richardson says common names gaslighting partners might use are "crazy" and "unstable." For instance, after being called out for raising their voice, she explains a gaslighting spouse may say, "You're crazy. I wasn't yelling at you."
"This is also a very defensive response, but it’s drawing on gaslighting techniques that make someone question their perceptions and reality," she shares.
The spouse who name-called also lied about yelling, but there are also examples.

"Let’s take this a step further and say that in response to partner B’s excessive spending, partner A takes partner B’s credit card out of their wallet without them knowing about it," Dr. Richardson says. "When partner B asks if partner A knows where their credit card is, partner A lies and says they do not."
This lie causes (completely unnecessary) stress and panic while also distorting reality—the pillars of gaslighting.

Say the argument between Partner A and Partner B overspending keeps going. Dr. Richardson says Partner A could kick the gaslighting up a notch by lodging an accusation at Partner B, like, "See? You are so irresponsible. You always lose things. This is why you cannot be trusted with money."
"These behaviors are red flags of gaslighting because they are very intentional and designed to make someone question their reality," she explains.
Dr. Richardson warns that gaslighters will frequently try to turn their partners against loved ones.

"The motivation behind this is that it is easier to manipulate and control someone when no one else is watching," she says. "A relationship is not an island and cannot exist on its own. Humans are social creatures, and it is important for married persons to still have a community beyond their marriage."

For example, a gaslighting spouse might say, "Your mom never wanted me to tell you this, but she told me when we met that you can never be trusted with money. She’ll deny it if you ask her because she doesn’t want to hurt your feelings.”
Dr. Richardson says that people who gaslight their partners don't always stop with people. They may also try to turn you off to things you love, like a hobby or cherished item.
"For example, an abusive partner might tell someone that...they constantly lose things, so that they cannot be trusted with a

heirloom," she explains. "Again, the point of this behavior is to make someone question their ability to care for themselves and others, including other things, and then they need to be dependent on their partner for help."
Your spouse may try to isolate you from the people you love, but Dr. Richardson says they're crucial.

"It is important that we have other people involved in our lives. This can include family members or friends," she explains. "When one partner is isolating the other from those that they care about, it is much easier for them to engage in abusive behaviors such as gaslighting because there is no one else around to point out what is happening."
Sometimes, our bellies deliver the hard truth that our heads and hearts try to deny.

"We all have intuition, and our bodies are programmed to let us know when something doesn’t feel right," Dr. Richardson says. "In order for someone to successfully gaslight another person, they need to create enough distrust so that the person no longer listens to their instincts. If a situation feels unsafe or unhealthy, it probably is. Seek out a neutral party to talk through."
Dr. Richardson says self-compassion is built on self-kindness,
and common humanity.

"It is not about self-pity but is about learning to treat ourselves the way that we would treat a loved one," she says. "We are often our harshest critics, and learning to be gentler with ourselves is often the first stop in
She explains mindfulness involves recognizing how we are internally and externally. It can help us tune into our intuition.

"Common humanity is the recognition that we are human beings with flaws," Dr. Richardson says. "We make mistakes, we make bad decisions sometimes, we are not always our best selves, and sometimes we choose the wrong partner."
Normalizing these experiences can help us become more compassionate with ourselves.
Help might include individual, couple's or family therapy.

These are big, important notes: "It is important to remember that we cannot force another person to get help, but we can get help for ourselves," Dr. Richardson says. When someone is the victim of gaslighting, they may need to work with a trauma specialist to help them recover and rebuild their sense of self."
She adds that you'll want to learn ways to manage conversations or interactions with an emotionally abusive person.

"Couples or family counseling is contraindicated if abuse is actively occurring in a marriage," Dr. Richardson says. "However, if the perpetrator has gotten individual help and is on the road to recovery, couples counseling can be very helpful to work on rebuilding trust and learning new, healthy relationship patterns."

title: Coach Outlet Is Selling a 'Stylish' $350 Belt Bag for Only $149, and Shoppers 'Absolutely Love' It
resume: "I get tons of compliments on it."
author: Michelle Regalado
segments: A stylish
can elevate any look, no matter the occasion. If you're always on the go and prefer carrying just the necessary essentials, skip the oversized
and
and try a sleek belt bag instead.
currently has some stunning options available at a steep discount.
Right now, the designer retailer is offering an incredible deal on one of its most versatile styles, the
. The chic bag, which typically retails for $350, is currently on sale for just $149 (over 55% off its original price).

Featuring a 48-inch adjustable strap, the versatile bag can be worn either at the waist or across the body. It's available in four neutral colors, making it easy to pair with just about any outfit. Depending on which shade you choose, it comes in one of three durable materials: signature canvas, denim, or pebbled leather.
At 11.25 inches long, 5.5 inches high, and 2.2 inches wide, the bag offers plenty of room to stash your daily must-haves, including keys, a
, and a phone. A removable coin case helps keep your loose change within reach, while an exterior zip pocket provides a handy spot for IDs, cash, or lip balm.
Shoppers "absolutely love" the sophisticated belt bag, calling it "functional and comfortable" and "exceptional quality."
"I use this '

' every time I go to the gym. It’s perfect for my workouts. It’s durable [and] can fit my earpods, gloves, wallet, lip gloss, and phone with room to spare," one shopper wrote. "It’s also very stylish and I get tons of compliments on it."

"This has by far been my most favorite bag of all time!" a second reviewer said. "To be honest, I hate carrying a bag and this is like carrying nothing at all. It’s so versatile and you can dress it up or down. I definitely recommend it!"
At just $149,
is sure to sell out fast, so grab it on sale while you can. And if you're also on the hunt for a larger, hands-free option, Coach Outlet is currently selling a
at a discount as well.

title: Lana Ja'Rae Breaks Down Why She Borrowed Kandy Muse's Pocket Dress for Season 17 (Exclusive)
resume: The latest eliminated queen from 'RuPaul's Drag Race' chats about becoming this season's lip sync assassin, her vulnerable monologue and why she loves wearing bathing suits.
author: Matthew Huff
segments: After being eliminated from
Season 17 this week,
, "getting eliminated is definitely something unique and different for me :/" This was indeed the New York drag queen's first time being told to sashay away, but the tweet is a reference to a
of Lana claiming that nearly every runway look she wore this season is "unique" or "different" for Lana.
"I'm not lying. I literally only wore bras and panties before
," Lana tells
, laughing after her elimination, "So going there, my goal was to showcase versatility. I think it's really funny that it's becoming as big of a
, because that didn't even cross my mind as something that would be picked up."

The 22-year-old queen is very much in on the joke, having been shown the meme by her fellow Season 17 girls while they performed together in Las Vegas. Lana, who is the drag daughter of Season 15 finalist
, made it to the final six before being eliminated by

following a monologues/interpretive dance challenge. Known for serving body, Lana stepped outside of her comfort zone often on the show, outlasting eight of her competitors and winning three lip syncs along the way.

When putting together her runways for the season, she knew she didn't want to be hit with the "relying on body" critique. "I was like, "OK, I can only show my body in a category where they asked me to show my body," which was the swimsuit category," she says. "So every other category, I wanted to make sure I tried to do something different or out of the ordinary for me, which wasn't hard because I literally only wore two pieces. I had to get this huge Pinterest board of fashion from the past, drawings, beautiful things outside. I just collected all of them together and tried to make sure everything was different and had unique silhouette. I feel like all my silhouettes have been pretty different, besides a puffy sleeve. I love a puffy sleeve. I can't run away from a puffy sleeve."
After her elimination, Lana sat down with
to spill the tea on her runway looks, her Rosa Parks impression and how she ended up wearing
's pocket dress on the runway.
Read the full interview below:
Sam Star lip syncs against Lana Ja'Rae

Absolutely, I'll be wearing bathing suits. It's summertime now. [Let the record show this interview was conducted on March 19, which is technically still winter.] I can't be wearing all this hot stuff during the summertime. It's just perfect for me to go back into my normal and show people what I do typically wear, that's not unique, and go back to my bathing suit two pieces.
I struggled with the ugliest dress category, because, believe it or not, being ugly is something that I don't tend to do. I think that was the last category I had ready for
because I kept going back and forth because I felt like it was so rude to ask a designer, "Hey, can you make me an outfit for the ugliest dress category?" No one wants to have an ugly outfit on
, and so then I was just watching

one day, and Season 13 came on and Kandy walked the pockets runway and the judges hated it so much. I asked Luxx, "Do you think Kandy will let me wear the pockets dress?" and she was like, "Honestly, it doesn't hurt to ask," and so I asked Kandy because I'm really close with like Kandy's drag
. She's like, "Sure I think Xunami has it," and so I got it from Xunami, and the rest is history.

Absolutely. I feel like that's one of the reasons I was thrown off so much at the beginning. I spiraled a bit because there's always like 17 New York girls in the season, and so when I walked in, I was waiting for the New York girls. Before I left for
, I was very secretive about being cast for

just because the girls talk. I didn't want to have my experience be ruined or canceled by like spilling that I was on. So I was like going to the Werk Room watching girls walking in one by one, waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting and there's none of the New York girls. I was like, "Oh my god, there's so much pressure to carry on the legacy of the city on my shoulders."

She helped me a lot. She went through all my looks. She helped me get out of my head, because I tend to be in my head a lot if you didn't know. She gave me good advice. I mean it I did not listen to the advice that she gave me, because it's very hard once you're there to try to stay in that headspace, but she was very helpful. She's an angel. She helped calm me down when I was having my
attacks.

Well, this entire season, I was waiting for girl groups, because I was like, "That is something I know I would thrive in." That's like my bread and butter performing, being pussy on stage. That's just what I live for. So, top six. It's going to be three and three. Girl group challenge. I'm here for it. They say "Charisma, Uniqueness, Nerve and Talent Monologues." I was like, "Oh my God, girl." I'm very happy that I was able to show some vulnerability with the challenge. I feel like I definitely misinterpreted what it was because watching it on

Season 6, it wasn't necessarily a comedy challenge. It was more just sharing their story with peeks of comedy, so that's what I would try to go for instead of it being a hee-haw-haw moment. I think I just definitely missed the mark, and misunderstood what they were asking for.
I feel like oftentimes I'm all smiles, and I feel like people forget sometimes that people who are all smiles also go through so much. I've been through so much in my
, and there's a reason why I only

and my entire brand is chasing your dreams, focusing on positivity, because I've gone through so much negative. I wanted to show people that the reason I am the way I am is because I do come from a lot, and it's okay, and you will make it through. That's something I wanted to share with everyone, because I didn't have a chance to really share that on the season yet. I was like, "Let me just like take this moment to be vulnerable with the judges." I think it was a different side of me that the judges hadn't seen before.

I don't necessarily regret the way I did the challenge. I mean, I regret flopping, but I don't necessarily regret the way I went. Looking back, maybe I would have done a different story, but I'm happy I chose that story.

I wish I chose a different character for Snatch Game. I feel like that could have changed my trajectory in the competition a little. I really try to live with no regrets because I believe everything happens for a reason. It was a learning lesson. So I don't necessarily think I would change anything, because even in my low moments, I learned so much about myself and it helped me in my high moments. I feel like me flopping with Snatch Game and the ball taught me maybe I'm not as good at the things I thought I was good at. Then doing good in the roast showed me I was good at things I didn't think I'd be good at. I'm very happy how everything's played out. All you can do is laugh.

I don't know. Every one was hard. I would say the most difficult one is tied between Crystal and Lydia. Because the Crystal one, I felt like I was fighting for my life. That was so intense. That was the first lip sync of the season where people were like, "My God, this is an elimination. This is like real." And then the Lydia one, I was in such a such a bad headspace in that lip sync. That was just so hard, because I was fully convinced I was going home that week. I had a great time in this last one. It was a really fun experience. But the other two I was like, "Oh my god, I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy, honestly."
RIGHT! I went out wearing something that I'd normally wear. I had to do it at least once in the season.

title: 'Suits' Star Reveals Why She Hasn't Watched Meghan Markle's Lifestyle Show
resume: Markle departed the hit show after seven seasons.
author: Gabriela Arevalo
segments: , who rose to fame on
before taking a break from television after her marriage to
, is back on the small screen with her new
series
Though the actress’ former
colleagues have been candid about them falling out of touch with her, they have also spoken publicly about being open to spending time with her again, whether
or by inviting her to be a
So perhaps it’s not surprising that one of those co-stars,
, admitted that while she hasn’t watched
, it’s on her to-do list.
Rafferty, who played quick-witted Donna Paulsen on the USA series, told
that she plans on watching the Netflix lifestyle show eventually, but is “saving” it for later.
According to the outlet, Rafferty is waiting for a moment in which she can relax and fully enjoy the show while watching it.
has proven to be a divisive series, with some fans
’s lifestyle program,
, and others defending Markle’s lifestyle tips and tricks.
One defender is
, who
on a recent episode of

“You know, I like the crafting thing… I have a chicken coop. I garden, I do all the things, and I learned how to make things by watching it. I thought it was great, and this is not new for her. For a long time, she ran a website called 'The Tig,' which I actually followed, and it was very good and gave just really good tips and she gives really good tips. I like it,” Hostin said on the March 8 weekend episode of the panel show.
“I watched it, I binged it. I loved it,” the talk show host told her colleagues.

title: Hallmark Actor Brennan Elliott Announces Shocking Loss
resume: Camilla Row, the wife of Hallmark actor Brennan Elliott, is dead at 45 after fighting gastric cancer since 2018.
author: K.L. Connie Wang
segments: We are sad to hear that
, 45, the wife of Hallmark actor
, succumbed to her fight against gastric cancer in the early
hours on Saturday, Mar. 22, 2025.

Elliott's wife, who was diagnosed back in 2018, fought the hard fight for so many years, undergoing multiple surgeries and various chemo and other therapy treatments in hopes of warding off the disease. Not long after she was diagnosed, Row had to have her entire stomach removed.
In an Instagram post on Saturday, Elliott shared the hard news with his fans. "There is no easy way to say this but I know my wife
would have wanted me to thank every person from all over the world who prayed for her over the last 8 years she suffered immeasurably trying to survive and live with
," he starts.
"It is with a soul crushing devastated heart that my beloved wife
passed away at 5:28 this morning. Our babies and I lost our rock, a person who not only was the love of my
,my soulmate,my
and lover but the toughest strongest fearless person I have ever met in my life and the greatest mother to her babies," he continues.
He added, "The pain she endured only I might know but assure all who loved her she is in
with no more pain. You are with the lord now my queen!🙏🙏. You are free! Heaven is a far better place with you in it my love. THANKYOU for being the best wife, mother and friend I’ve ever known."
Back in 2018, the clinical psychologist thought she was having bouts of

that wouldn't go away. It got so severe she thought she might be having a heart attack. After visiting three doctors, the unbelievable diagnosis came back. Row had Stage 1B gastric adenocarcinoma. Within months, she had to have her stomach removed and began chemotherapy.
Pictured (L to R): Camilla Row, Brennan Elliott (Source: Instagram)

Fast forward to 2021. Row's cancer came back, and this time it was Stage 4. With two small kids, a loving husband, and everything to live for, Row was determined to beat it, or at least keep it at bay. She seemed to do so several times, losing her hair multiple times when she had to go through another round of chemo. She even had several rounds of HIPEC surgery, where surgeons go in, remove any visible tumors and pour warm chemotherapy directly into the abdomen area where the cancer is present.

She began chronicling her journey as a cancer patient on Instagram. Many saw their jaws drop at the sheer amount of strength this woman had, mentally and physically, to withstand the number of chemo treatments, HIPEC surgeries, daily struggles to keep food down or keep her energy up. She became the unofficial ambassador for gastric cancer and cancer research, speaking of her experiences at many functions.
Fellow Hallmark actors responded in kind to Elliott's post.
posted, "Mate, sending you and the
all the love & strength there is in the world. My arms are flying across seas to hug you tight my friend. ♥️:"
posted, "Oh my sweet friend
so much. This is the nightmare. Please know I am right here for you and the kids and holding you so tight in my heart right now."
Personally, this author had the opportunity to meet Row during a Hallmark Channel event. It was my early days writing for

and I used to reply to Brennan's tweets or tag him in some of my own. At the time, I had a cartoon version of me as my profile pic. I was talking to Brennan at the event when his wife came up to me and exclaimed, "You must be Connie Wang! I recognize you from your profile pic!" Surprised, I laughed and thought, "I could totally be friends with this woman!" I am certainly sorry to see she is gone, but happy to know she will no longer be in pain.
Row is survived by her husband, Brennan Elliott and their two children, Liam and Luna.

title: Fans Stunned As Fire Breaks Out at Disney World’s EPCOT Park
resume: The 'heartbreaking' situation shocked fans of the well-known theme park.
author: Devon Forward
segments: Fans of
were stunned to see what happened at EPCOT in
on the night of Saturday, March 22 when a fire broke out in the France Pavilion, which is part of the World Showcase section of the park.
News of the fire spread as videos online showed the smoke, with some people forced to evacuate the
ride as a result of the fire that took place backstage.
Walt Disney World confirmed to
that a walk-in cooler caught on fire backstage at the France Pavilion in the afternoon. Some people were forced to evacuate the
-themed attraction, but Disney World stated that the fire was officially put out by 7:20 p.m. EPCOT closed for the night at its regularly scheduled time of 9 p.m. No injuries were reported.
People visiting the park spotted a plume of smoke in the evening on Saturday coming from the France Pavilion, sharing videos online and sparking concern from fans elsewhere.

One fan, known as ryanwmsn on X, rode in a Disney Skyliner gondola over the park, giving them a clear view of the smoke. Some of the flames could also be seen backstage near the entrance to Remy's Ratatouille Adventure.
The video quickly

, with fans sharing their earnest reactions, such as one who said, "Heartbreaking to see this happen at such a beloved place. Hope everyone is safe, and that the magic of EPCOT can be restored soon. 💔🙏."
Some joked about the fire's connection to the
ride, saying things like, "Maybe not anyone CAN cook," and "Looks like Remy might have left the oven on…
Walt Disney World is likely experiencing higher volume this month, as many schools are on spring break, while EPCOT's International Flower & Garden Festival is going on until June 2.

title: The Perfect Sunday Reset Routine To Rest, Recover and Recenter
resume: No 'Sunday Scaries' here—we're all about slowing down at the end of the weekend.
author: Kelsey Kryger
segments: Sundays are a designated day for resting, recovering and resetting for the new week ahead. Out of all of the days in the week, Sundays serve as a universal pause button, giving us the chance to slow down and set the tone for the week. The best part about a
is that it is the antithesis of hustle and bustle—the perfect end-of-week schedule encourages

and measuring our productivity as a means of self-worth are deeply ingrained in many of us. Heck, many folks still unconsciously compete with each other regarding who has the busier schedule as if it's a badge of honor. Having a Sunday reset routine that fills your cup is a secret weapon in battling against
Everyone is different, and thus, everyone's weekend schedule will vary. What's important is that your
revitalizes your mind, body and spirit—leaving you feeling restored as you head into the new week.
A Sunday reset is a routine that allows folks to rejuvenate, refocus and prepare for the upcoming week—no matter what they have in store. Sunday reset routines serve as
to unwind and engage in
. It's also a great time to attend to house chores and other errands we may not always have the time to do on the weekdays.

Everyone's weekly Sunday rituals look different, but they often include a combination of activities such as creating your schedule for the week, doing an intricate skincare routine, taking a long bath,
and more.

If you're wondering how to design your perfect Sunday reset routine, just remember that there's no right or wrong way to structure it. The most important component is having a healthy combination of productive activities and restful activities. Start by evaluating your upcoming week, including any priorities, work tasks or events you have to consider. This can help you decide what you need to get a jumpstart on, like laundry or meal-prepping.
creator
explains that she breaks up her Sunday reset into different categories—including self-care, environmental,

and mental. Self-care includes activities like doing a full skincare routine, while environmental includes activities like washing your bed sheets. Having these different categories with activities to pull from helps ensure you're balancing productivity with rest.
If you're still stumped on what specific activities to include in your perfect Sunday reset routine,
has you covered. Read the list below for your Sunday reset checklist:

title: Costco Just Added a Beautiful Set of Vibrant Glasses That are Similar to Pottery Barn Style Nearly 2x the Price
author: Kenn Bivins
segments: As human beings, we’re innately attracted to shiny things that sparkle and catch our attention from afar.

and gems, gold and rare metals, and even twinkly glassware all seem to send us into trance-like states where we seem to wander toward them like we’re hypnotized. There’s probably a more scientific explanation for why we see shiny items as trophies for us to collect, but the social reason is because we equate shiny with wealth.

The ancient Egyptians collected jewels and rare stones en masse and often buried pharaohs and queens with their trinkets to take with them into the afterlife. It’s no wonder we still practice similar customs today by hoarding fine china and fragile dinnerware sets to pass down from generation to generation. Personally, my vice happens to be glassware in all its forms.
over&back Stemless Drinking Glasses
There’s something about holding a delicate wine glass filled with high-quality

that feels almost poetic. Glass is made from sand heated over time, and the wine is hand-made by fermentation to create an elixir that tastes like it was handed down from the Gods. Even if you aren’t into traditional glassware, there are plenty of non-traditional options out there, and
has some of the best.
In fact, their latest looks just like a set from Pottery Barn for almost half the price. A stunning

and they’re perfect for all the al fresco dinners we’re gearing up to have this spring. These gorgeous handblown glasses come in three stunning colorways—purple, smoke, and green—and can hold a whopping 18-ounces of your chosen beverage.
The glasses are dishwasher-safe, making clean-up after use a breeze, and at just $27.99 for the set, these are a certified steal. In comparison, the
from Pottery Barn come in a multicolored set and only hold 16-ounces for a hefty $49.50. How’s that for a deal? Maybe it’s not so bad that we’re attracted to shiny things after all?

title: TLC Star Baylen Dupree Sparks Confusion With Wedding Photos
resume: The ‘Baylen Out Loud’ star’s fans had a lot of questions for the TLC personality.
author: Gabriela Arevalo
segments: has hit a lot of major milestones recently, but the TLC star recently confused fans who thought that she’d hit yet another one after a recent social media post.
The
star took to Instagram to share some sweet photos of herself and her fiancé,
, captioning the carousel “Congrats to the Dupree’s.”

The couple was dressed up in the photos, with Dupree wearing a floor-length pale yellow dress and tan sandals. She wore her hair in loose waves and accessorized with dangling earrings as she posed next to Dooley, who wore a charcoal suit over a white dress shirt.

The two stood in a garden in front of a lush display of pastel flowers at the end of a paved walkway, and it seems like some fans mistook their pose, their placement, and a sign in another photo that said “The Duprees” as an indication that they were not just guests at a wedding, but that it was a wedding festivity for them.
“Such a solid and loving couple! Couldn’t be happier for you two 😍,” wrote one fan as another agreed, writing, “Beautiful pics guys 🥰 Many years of
& love ❤️.” Another fan said, “They got married! 😮 Congratulations ❤️,” prompting others to ask, “Are they married now? When is the new season coming out? 😮.”
“So he took her
???” asked a fan and another was on the same page with a similar question, commenting, ““The Duprees? Colin taking Baylen's last name?”

Other fans were quick to point out that this wasn’t their wedding, but likely the wedding for one of Dupree’s relatives. “Maybe a family wedding they attended. They are so cute together ❤️,” one fan said, as another wrote, “This is her and Colin at her cousins wedding.”

A third fan was more direct in their correction, writing, “Y’all look so adorable… Clearly one of her brothers/family members got married… Y’all chill…” as another commented, “Her maiden name is Dupree. This has to be a family members wedding on her dad’s side.”

title: The Genius Way to Make the Crispiest Potato Skins
resume: Snack time just got way better!
author: Angel Albring
segments: are one of the most beloved foods in the world, cherished for their versatility, comforting taste and ability to be transformed into countless delicious dishes. Whether
or baked,
hold a special place in people’s hearts and kitchens.
are a universal favorite, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, perfect with ketchup or dipped in
sauce.
bring warmth and comfort, especially when topped with butter, gravy, or even a sprinkle of cheese.
, with their crispy skin and soft interior, can be loaded with sour cream,
, and chives for a hearty meal.

One often-overlooked favorite is potato skins—crispy, cheesy, and packed with flavor. These tasty bites take full advantage of the potato’s crispy outer layer, and they pack a satisfying crunch. They're often the stuff of bar menus, but they're also pretty darn easy to make at home.
Content creator and cookbook author Yumna Jawad (
) shared one way to get the crispiest potato skins ever, and we love this! This is going to be a great appetizer or snack. We're thinking they'd make a great addition to our
menu, but no matter what you're celebrating, tater skins are a solid snack.

Potato skins are a wonderful snack because they take everything great about potatoes and turn them into the perfect handheld bite. Yumna said that one of the best ways to make them shine is by loading them with melted extra sharp white
and
them.

To make them, wash your potatoes, season the skins and bake them. Once they are soft, open them and scoop out the fluffy insides. Then, brush the inside of the hollowed-out potatoes with melted butter and air fry the skins.
Pro-tip: don't throw out the potato filling. You can store this to make quick mashed potatoes.

Air frying the potato skins first ensures they get golden and crisp, creating the perfect base for all that gooey, sharp cheddar goodness. Shred your cheese and when the potato skins are done, fill them with extra sharp white cheddar and cook them a little longer in the
, until the cheese melts.

To take them to the next level, top your cheesy potato skins with your favorite toppings, like sour cream and green onions or go for something a little different, like sundried tomatoes for a tangy twist. The beauty of potato skins is their versatility—you can load them up however you like!

For other variations, try adding crispy bacon for a smoky crunch or diced jalapeños. You can also get your inspiration from classic chicken wings and drizzle the potato skins with ranch dressing and/or a little buffalo sauce for an extra punch of flavor.
I would love to make these topped with cheddar, barbecue sauce and pulled
or spoon some chili on top of them. Yum!
You can also mix and match cheese for a deeper flavor. Parmesan and mozzarella would also be great on crispy potato skins dipped in marinara and pepper jack would give it a spicy kick.
However you top them, these potato skins are sure to be a hit with your crowd!

title: 'Law & Order: SVU' Actor Sentenced to 25 Years to Life for Murder
resume: The longtime actor was convicted of the crime earlier this month.
author: Devon Forward
segments: , who has had a long acting career with roles in major television shows like
and
, among others, has been sentenced to 25 years to
in prison for the 2021 murder of
Stokes was officially convicted of murder in the second degree and two counts of criminal possession of a weapon in the second degree, as stated in an
from Queens District Attorney

Katz shared a statement about the decision, saying, "Justice has now been served for the premeditated murder perpetrated by this defendant and he will now spend 25 years to life in prison as a direct consequence of his criminal actions.”
Stokes was convicted of the charges earlier this month after a two-week trial. In a

posted after the trial, Katz called the crime a "calculated murder," adding, "I thank our prosecutors and the NYPD detectives who built this case. The jury has now spoken, and the defendant faces up to 25 years to life at sentencing for his criminal actions.”

Jones was shot and killed in Queens, N.Y. on Feb. 7, 2021, with the press release saying, "The shooting is believed to have been retaliation for an altercation between the defendant and the victim at the victim’s
party in October 2020."
Stokes has been a working actor since the mid-2000s, with his first official television job appearing in two episodes of
in 2006. In 2009, he had a role in
, and over the years, he has had small parts in other TV staples like
, and

title: Gwyneth Paltrow Issues Bold Take on Meghan Markle's Lifestyle Show
resume: ‘With Love, Meghan’ has drawn comparisons to Paltrow’s wellness and lifestyle brand, Goop.
author: Gabriela Arevalo
segments: ’s latest venture, a show on
called
, has been
to
’s lifestyle show as well as
’s Goop brand.
Now, Paltrow is giving her take on Markle’s program, even though she admits that while she’s “met Meghan, who seems really lovely,” she doesn’t “know her at all.”
In a recent interview with
, Paltrow opened up about her Montecito, Calif. neighbor’s lifestyle program, which has been compared to Goop for its health and wellness focus.

“I was raised to see other women as friends, not foes,” Paltrow told the outlet. “I think there’s always more than enough to go around. Everybody deserves an attempt at everything that they want to try.”
Though the brands operate in similar spaces, Paltrow said when “there’s noise about certain women in the culture, I do have, always, a strong instinct to stand up for them,” a marked difference from
’s
about Goop, in which she said, “If she were confident in her acting, she wouldn’t be trying to be Martha Stewart.”

While Paltrow’s celebrity status has undoubtedly helped elevate her brand into the cultural zeitgeist, it’s a double-edged sword. She noted that negative coverage of her as a celebrity “can impact sales.”

“It used to be, ‘We can take shots at these models or movie stars ’cause it’s fun to read,’” she said, but “if it’s not true and you’re creating a negative perception about any one of our businesses, what’s your responsibility there? It’s different than just saying, ‘Look at this gross picture of Gwyneth on a beach on vacation.’”

title: Priscilla Presley Shares Footage of Her Visit to Germany Where She First Met Elvis
resume: The 79-year-old shared some 'precious memories' with her fans.
author: Devon Forward
segments: took a meaningful walk down memory lane while on an overseas trip to Germany recently for a special show called
on March 22.
While in Germany, she stopped in the town of Bad Nauheim, where she first met her late husband,
and he was in the U.S. Army.

Priscilla shared a video showing a montage of photos from the trip, including visits to displays honoring Presley, with old photos of the singer and what appeared to be one of his army uniforms in a case.
"More of my trip in Germany-P🌹," Priscilla captioned the update, which also included photos from her show at the Dolce Jugendstil-Theater.

Fans shared appreciation for the post, writing kind notes like, "i hope you are enjoying your trip, so many precious memories 💗💗," and "This is so beautiful how Germany forever remembers the endless love between you and Elvis ❤️❤️❤️."
While in Bad Nauheim, Priscilla also got to see the town's new statue of Presley for the first time,
of herself posing in front of it.
She shared how much the moment meant to her while speaking with reporters in Germany, via
, saying, "This is very important to me. Being back brings back so many memories of that time.”
When she was a young teenager, Priscilla moved from Texas to Germany with her stepfather,
, who was an Air Force officer.

She shared what her classmates said when she left Texas, saying, "The teenagers that I knew back in Texas would all say, ‘Oh, you’re going to where Elvis Presley is. He’s over there at the same place that you’re going to go to.'"
"I never in my imagination thought that I would meet him," she concluded.
While Presley left Germany about six months after the two met, they kept in contact for years before Priscilla moved to Memphis, Tenn. The couple got married in 1967.

title: 'Vanderpump Rules' Fans Divided by Tom Sandoval's New Video: 'The Hustle Is Real'
resume: The Bravo star’s fans can’t agree on his latest venture.
author: Gabriela Arevalo
segments: made serious waves in 2023 when it came out that the
star had been unfaithful to his partner of many years, fellow
, with their
castmate

The subsequent fallout from the affair, dubbed “Scandoval” by fans, resulted in a redemption tour by Sandoval, a departure from the reality show by Leviss, and new career opportunities for Madix, including a hosting gig on
and a Broadway run in
While none of them are expected to return for the show’s 12th season, they’re all still in the public eye, and fans are divided by Sandoval’s latest venture.
The reality star took to

on March 23 to tell fans that he’s available to record personalized videos through Cameo. The site allows fans to hire celebrities and internet personalities to record a video message for a set fee. Users are asked to provide facts about the recipient so that the person recording the video can be specific in their message.
Sandoval rattled off a long list of events for which he could record cameos, from birthdays to bachelor or
, weddings, engagements, or if “you need a pick-me-up.”

He then explained that on previous cameos he has played trumpet, sharing with a laugh that he's “played some guitar, I’ve been asked to sing some lullabies,” and urging fans to book through the website as opposed to the app because “it is so much cheaper to book online.”
Fans quickly took to the comments to share their opinion, with many teasing the
alum, writing, “This is like a parody of Tom Sandoval,” and stating that he “still gives me a giant ICK.”
Other fans loved the idea, commenting, “Well, I have to honestly say it’s very refreshing to see you
I think the world has been so cruel for too long and it’s good that you’re finally getting back to being the Tom we love.”
“I think you're pretty awesome! Yes you've made some mistakes but you've kept your sense of humor and I support grabbing every opportunity that is out there! Good for you!” wrote another.
Others were more neutral on the topic, writing, “He is unapologetically himself,” and “One thing I can say is Tom is funny.”
One fan said it succinctly, noting that “the hustle is real.”

title: Trisha Yearwood is ‘Literal Perfection’ in Mischievous New Video
resume: Fans couldn't get over the star's 'incredible sense of humor.'
author: Devon Forward
segments: proved that her talent as an entertainer goes beyond just a great singing voice, as the country star showed off her cheeky sense of humor in a new video.

The 60-year-old took to Instagram on Sunday, March 23 to share a hilarious new clip of herself pretending she didn't want to sing as she lip-synced to audio that repeatedly said, "Don't make me sing."
Yearwood's funny video is a reference to a
character played by
over a decade ago. The country singer perfectly evoked the character, and at the end of the video, she pulled a microphone from behind her back as the audio said, "Oh, I could sing one, I guess."
Fans loved the cheeky, playful video from Yearwood, with one fan declaring her "literal perfection." Another said that she was "My favorite comedian fr 😂 lmao."
"I love this!!! Not only do you have one of the most amazing voices in
…but you’ve got an incredible sense of humor as well!!" wrote a third fan.
Others called the clip "hysterical" and "iconic," while many shared full support as they urged Yearwood to sing all the time.
In the original
skit, Wiig was a host at a 1920s party at which a guest, played by
, was asked to play the piano.

Despite no one asking her, Wiig pretended they requested that she sing as well and she was reluctantly agreeing. Once the performance started, Wiig's character proved that there might've be a good reason why no one really asked her to sing.

title: I Tried the Super Simple Lazy Daisy Cake and It's My New Favorite Anytime Dessert
resume: It couldn't be easier—or more delicious!
author: Angel Albring
segments: I’ve always loved baked goods—warm
fresh from the oven, a perfectly soft
or a slice of
with my
. But since going

-free, finding quick and delicious options has been a challenge. Store-bought gluten-free treats can be hit or miss, and while I enjoy baking, it’s not always fast or convenient. Between specialty flours, extra steps and the occasional baking fail, whipping up something satisfying isn’t as simple as it used to be.
But then I heard about
and immediately knew I had to give it a try. Anything that calls itself “lazy” in the kitchen is already speaking my language!

Lazy Daisy Cake is an old-fashioned sponge cake that’s light and fluffy, but the magic happens after it bakes. Instead of frosting, you spread a rich, buttery coconut topping over the warm cake and then pop it under the broiler. The topping caramelizes into a sweet, crunchy layer that’s hard to resist. It’s like a cake and a dessert topping in one and there’s zero extra effort required!

This cake became popular in the early 1900s, supposedly because it was simple enough for “lazy” bakers. Whether that’s true or not, I love how easy it is to whip up, and it’s even simpler when you use a boxed cake mix (which I did).
I love baking from scratch, but I needed an easy, no-fuss dessert, which is why I decided to make this

with a gluten-free boxed cake mix. And it worked like a dream! I used Milk Street's Danish dream cake recipe, which is similar to Lazy Daisy Cake, as inspiration, but you can find lots of variations on this recipe online, including one from

To make my version of Lazy Daisy Cake, you'll need a box of yellow or white cake mix (I used a yellow gluten-free mix) and the ingredients listed on the cake mix box. For the topping, you'll need butter,
, heavy cream and shredded sweetened coconut.

Prepare the cake batter according to the instructions on the box. Bake in a greased 9-by-13 inch pan at the recommended temperature. (My gluten-free mix needed a couple of extra minutes to set properly, so keep an eye on it.)
While the cake is baking, make the topping by melting the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the brown sugar, heavy cream and coconut. Cook for about a minute until well combined.
Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and turn the broiler on. Spread the coconut topping evenly over the warm cake.
Place the cake under the broiler for 1–2 minutes, watching closely until the topping is bubbly and golden brown. This part happens fast, so don’t walk away!
Let it cool slightly before slicing. Serve warm for the best experience.

Making this cake with a boxed mix was a total win. The cake came out soft and fluffy, and the coconut topping added the perfect crunch and sweetness. It took barely any effort and I love that it’s a cake you don’t have to frost, and it feels special without being fussy.
Personally, I’d add more coconut and brown sugar topping because my cake was very fluffy and it needed more. I think adding some
slices to the top before putting the cake under the broiler would be fantastic. Still, this cake was so good I ate it for breakfast the next day!
My kids loved this cake, too. My seven-year-old said it is now his favorite cake because he doesn't like frosting and this Lazy Daisy Cake was sweet without being too much.
My neighbor also tried it and said it was delicious. She agreed that she'd add more topping, though.
If you’re looking for a super easy dessert that still tastes homemade, Lazy Daisy Cake is a must-try. Sometimes, shortcuts are the way to go, especially when they taste this good!

title: TikTok Video About Laundry Hack Sparks Heated Debate
resume: Social media users were firmly divided on the hack’s effectiveness.
author: Gabriela Arevalo
segments: Everybody approaches household tasks differently, differing on the best way to
and the most effective way to
While people tend to be fairly set in their ways about how they want those tasks done, there’s usually an “agree to disagree” mentality. Unless you’re the
of Tiktok user ilukugh.
Earlier this month, the “Australian in the US” took to the social media platform with a video of “mental behaviour in the house tonight” that showed the unnamed boyfriend’s tactic for doing laundry.
At the start of the video, he could be seen smiling at the camera as the words “Help?? I just asked my bf where the cap for the detergent is and he said ‘Oh I just fill it up and throw it in?’”
As the video continued, a dramatic opera song played in the background as the text questioned why the cap was thrown into the washer with the clothes.
“He’s so convinced this is normal that he’s looking for ‘where it says it on the box,’” the text then read as the video showed him intensely scanning the back of a bottle of Gain laundry detergent.
Thousands of comments flooded the video, with people defending and scolding the method in equal measure.
“Yes this is normal,” said one commenter, and others agreed, writing, “Yes and then it doesn’t get sticky,” with more explaining that they do this to avoid getting detergent residue on the cap.

Another said “this is literally the directions on most detergents,” while others were baffled and swore they’d never heard of that before. “I was expecting all of these comments to be like yeah that’s insane but instead I’m just more confused,” said one comment. “My Kirkland brand has this in the bottle instructions!
doesn’t lie, so it’s truth,” said another.
“There’s no way this comment section is real. Do you people also bake your measuring cups inside your bread,” read one comment, with many declaring that this was
and stating that “this comment section has me questioning if I’m the one doing it wrong.”

title: Eva Longoria Puts on Busty Display in 'Stunning' Sundress
resume: The actress welcomed the spring season in style.
author: Devon Forward
segments: is fully embracing the spring season, welcoming the change in style as she stunned fans with her latest look.
The actress shared a new photo on Instagram a few days after the official start of spring, announcing with both her words and her fashion that "Spring is here🌸."

In the photo, Longoria looked radiant in a flowing patterned dress in white and green with some peach-colored undertones, paired with white pointed heels. Her hair was down in soft waves and she accessorized with dangling earrings, a few rings and a simple necklace.
Longoria didn't share any details about where the picture was taken, but there were palm trees and a bright blue sky visible behind her.
Fans were overwhelmed by the look, with one outright saying, "I think im in love..." Others commented, "So pretty 🤍," "So beautiful with class and style!!❤️," and "Absolutely stunning!!!! 🌹."
"Love that dress on you Eva💕," said a different fan, while another declared Longoria, "As bright as the 🌞."
Longoria turned 50 years old on March 15, and during a recent appearance on
, the actress teased her international
celebrations.
"I'm celebrating for the year. So you're gonna see a lot more birthday photos," she began. "I started in Miami, so I've been, like, drunk for two days. I probably still have a lot of
in my system right now. So then we came here to New York, and then I'm going to celebrate in Mexico City, in L.A., and Paris."
Along with her milestone birthday, Longoria is also promoting the release of her movie
, which premieres on
on March 28.
